files.name: README_DEPLOY.md
files.content:
# Terraform deployment (ECS Fargate + ALB)

## Prereqs
- Terraform >= 1.5
- AWS credentials configured (env vars, profile, or SSO)
- Docker (to build/push the container image)

## Build a production container image
This repo does not include a Dockerfile. A minimal example:

```dockerfile
FROM python:3.12-slim
WORKDIR /app
COPY app.py /app/app.py
RUN pip install --no-cache-dir flask gunicorn
ENV PORT=8000
EXPOSE 8000
CMD ["gunicorn", "-b", "0.0.0.0:8000", "app:app"]
```

## Push image to ECR
After `terraform apply`, use the output `ecr_repository_url`.

```bash
aws ecr get-login-password --region us-east-1 | docker login --username AWS --password-stdin <account>.dkr.ecr.us-east-1.amazonaws.com

docker build -t flask-api:latest .
docker tag flask-api:latest <ecr_repository_url>:latest
docker push <ecr_repository_url>:latest
```

Then update the service by re-applying (or force new deployment):

```bash
terraform apply
# or
aws ecs update-service --cluster <cluster> --service <service> --force-new-deployment
```

## HTTPS
Set `enable_https=true` and provide `acm_certificate_arn`.
